name: Stones
overview: A puzzle game created by Helfried Peyrl and published in both 64'er 1993/11, and 64'er 1999/01. Thirty tricky levels with super graphics are packed in 5-KByte for the player, Stones makes for a smoking head and hustle and bustle on the joystick. After the start you get into the game with the fire button. The stones are set up and must be cleared from the screen within a certain time limit. To do this, the flashing cursor is moved to one of the gray stones with the joystick and confirmed by pressing a button. Existing stones are deleted to the left, right, top and bottom of the stone and empty spaces are filled with stones again. Stones arranged diagonally are not affected by the process. Three lives are available to solve the thirty built-in levels, with one being deducted if the player exceeds the time limit.
